title: Syndicator A Feed Not Updating - API Connection Issues
problem: Dealer's vehicle inventory is not appearing on Syndicator A or listings are outdated. This typically occurs when the Syndicator A API connection has been interrupted or credentials have expired.
solution: Re-authenticate the Syndicator A API connection and trigger a manual feed sync. This restores the connection and pushes the current inventory to Syndicator A.
steps: Log into the dealer's account in the syndication management system
Navigate to Integrations > Syndicators > Syndicator A
Check the API status indicator - if red or yellow, connection needs refresh
Click 'Re-authenticate' and follow the OAuth flow
After successful authentication, click 'Manual Sync Now'
Monitor the sync progress - typically completes in 5-10 minutes
Verify vehicles appear on Syndicator A by spot-checking 3-5 random listings

edge_cases.description: Syndicator A account has been suspended or flagged
edge_cases.symptoms: Authentication succeeds but vehicles still don't appear after sync
edge_cases.specific_solution: Contact Syndicator A support to resolve account suspension
specific_steps: Verify authentication is successful in our system
Log into Syndicator A dealer portal directly
Check for any account notifications or warnings
If account is suspended, contact Syndicator A dealer support
Provide dealer account number and business verification
Once resolved by Syndicator A, trigger manual sync from our system

related_issues: Syndicator A listings showing wrong prices
Syndicator A photos not displaying correctly

title: Provider A (Provider A) Import Failures - File Format Issues
problem: Vehicle data import from Provider A (Provider A) is failing or incomplete. Dealers notice missing vehicles or incorrect data after Provider A import runs.
solution: Verify Provider A export file format and column mappings, then re-run the import with corrected settings.
steps: Access the dealer's Provider A import settings in Admin > Data Providers
Download the latest Provider A export file from the dealer's Provider A account
Open the file and verify column headers match our expected format
Check for common issues: extra commas, missing VIN column, date format mismatches
If format is incorrect, update the column mapping in our system
Re-upload the file and trigger a manual import
Review import log for any errors
Verify imported vehicles appear correctly in the inventory

title: Syndicator B Pricing Sync Issues
problem: Vehicle prices on Syndicator B don't match the dealer's actual pricing. This can lead to customer complaints and lost sales opportunities.
solution: Force a pricing sync from the inventory management system to Syndicator B and verify pricing rules are correctly configured.
steps: Navigate to the dealer's Syndicator B sync settings
Check the pricing rule configuration - verify markup/markdown percentages
Compare a few sample vehicles: internal price vs Syndicator B displayed price
If prices are incorrect, update pricing rules as needed
Click 'Force Price Sync' to immediately push correct prices
Wait 15-20 minutes for Syndicator B to process the update
Spot-check 5-10 vehicles on Syndicator B to confirm correct pricing
Document any pricing rule changes made

edge_cases.description: Dealer using custom pricing tiers by vehicle type
edge_cases.symptoms: Some vehicle types show correct pricing but others don't
edge_cases.specific_solution: Configure per-category pricing rules in Syndicator B settings
specific_steps: Go to Syndicator B Settings > Advanced > Pricing Rules
Set appropriate markup/markdown for that category
Verify each category shows correct pricing on Syndicator B

related_issues: Syndicator B photos out of sync

title: Syndicator C Marketplace Photos Not Displaying
problem: Vehicle listings on Syndicator C Marketplace appear without photos or with broken image links, reducing listing effectiveness.
solution: Verify image URLs are publicly accessible and meet Syndicator C's requirements, then re-sync the photo feed.
steps: Check if photos display correctly in our internal system
Test a few image URLs directly in browser - should load without authentication
Verify images meet Syndicator C requirements: JPEG/PNG, max 8MB, min 400x300px
Navigate to Syndicator C Marketplace settings in our system
Check 'Photo Sync' status - should show last successful sync time
If sync failed, review error log for specific issues
Click 'Resync All Photos' to push images to Syndicator C
Wait 30-60 minutes for Syndicator C to process images
Verify photos appear on Syndicator C Marketplace listings

title: Syndicator E Duplicate Listings
problem: Same vehicles appear multiple times on Syndicator E, causing confusion and potential policy violations with Syndicator E.
solution: Identify duplicate VINs, remove the duplicates, and implement VIN de-duplication rules to prevent future occurrences.
steps: Access Syndicator E sync log and identify duplicate VINs
Check our inventory system for duplicate VIN entries
If duplicates exist internally, merge or remove them first
Navigate to Syndicator E Settings > Duplicate Prevention
Enable 'VIN De-duplication' if not already enabled
Click 'Remove Duplicates from Syndicator E'
Review the list of vehicles that will be removed
Confirm removal and wait for sync to complete (10-15 minutes)
Verify each VIN now appears only once on Syndicator E
related_issues: Multiple feeds sending to same syndicator

title: Provider B Integration Connection Timeout
problem: Connection to Provider B DMS times out when attempting to pull inventory data, preventing automatic inventory updates.
solution: Verify Provider B credentials, check firewall rules, and re-establish the connection with increased timeout settings.
steps: Navigate to Admin > Data Providers > Provider B
Test the connection by clicking 'Test Connection'
If timeout occurs, check Provider B credentials are current
Verify dealer's Provider B account is active and API access enabled
Check if dealer's firewall is blocking our IP addresses
Provide dealer's IT with our IP whitelist if needed
Increase connection timeout setting from 30s to 60s
Retry connection test
If successful, trigger a full inventory sync
Monitor sync completion and log any errors

edge_cases.description: Provider B server maintenance window causing timeouts
edge_cases.symptoms: Connection works sometimes but fails during specific hours
edge_cases.specific_solution: Schedule syncs outside of Provider B maintenance windows
specific_steps: Contact dealer to confirm Provider B maintenance schedule
Check our sync schedule in System > Scheduled Tasks
Update sync time to avoid Provider B maintenance hours
Set up backup sync time as fallback
Enable email notifications for failed syncs
Document maintenance window in dealer's account notes

title: Missing Vehicle Features/Options in Syndication
problem: Vehicle features and options (leather seats, navigation, etc.) are not appearing on syndicated listings, reducing listing quality and customer interest.
solution: Verify feature data is present in source system, map feature codes correctly, and re-sync listings with complete feature data.
steps: Check if features appear in our internal inventory view
If missing internally, verify data source (DMS/provider) includes features
Navigate to Settings > Feature Mapping
Review feature code mappings for the data provider
Test mapping with a sample vehicle
If mappings are incorrect, update the feature dictionary
Force a full re-sync of affected vehicles
Verify features now appear on syndicated platforms
Spot-check 5-10 vehicles on each syndicator

title: Dealer Website Not Reflecting Inventory Changes
problem: Vehicles sold or added are not updating on the dealer's website, causing customer confusion and potential compliance issues.
solution: Clear website cache, verify CMS integration, and force a content refresh to sync current inventory to the website.
steps: Check when the website was last refreshed - view Site > Cache Status
Verify the CMS integration is active and credentials are valid
Clear the website cache: Site > Clear Cache > Confirm
Trigger a full inventory refresh: Site > Force Rebuild
Wait for rebuild to complete (typically 2-5 minutes)
Test the website in an incognito/private browser window
Verify recently sold vehicles are marked as sold/removed
Verify newly added vehicles appear on the website
Clear CDN cache if using a CDN: Site > CDN > Purge All
